subject_line: CGMs, Gut Health, and Carnivore Cake?
opening: Big week over here. We published 13 new articles, including a deep dive where all three of us weighed in on continuous glucose monitors. Emma the Carnivore broke the internet with a zero-carb cake recipe. And the gut health paradox piece is already our most-shared article this month. Let's get into it.

whats_trending:
CGMs on carnivore — everyone wants to see their flat glucose lines and freak out about dawn phenomenon. Our three-writer deep dive covers the science, the protocol, and what the community is actually seeing.

Gut health without fiber — the paradox is catching on. No fiber, better digestion. The gastroenterologists are not thrilled, but the data is interesting.

Skin healing stories — eczema and psoriasis results are flooding the community forums. Turns out acne clearing was just the beginning.
community_pulse: The questions I'm seeing most this week center around blood sugar and metabolic health. A lot of people are strapping on CGMs for the first time and wondering why their fasting glucose went up after starting carnivore. Short answer: it's normal, it's temporary, and we wrote an entire article explaining the mechanisms. I'm also seeing renewed interest in the gut health conversation, especially from people whose gastroenterologists told them fiber was non-negotiable. The data tells a more interesting story.
looking_ahead: Next week: carnivore on a budget (real numbers, real meal plans) and a deep dive into recovery protocols for training athletes. More research, less noise. See you Monday.
